critique: This document establishes the Office of Scientific Research and Development within the Office for Emergency Management during World War II. It centralizes scientific research efforts related to national defense under a Director appointed by the President. The order outlines the responsibilities of the office, including advising the President, coordinating research activities, and supporting scientific research related to warfare and medical problems affecting national defense. It also establishes advisory councils and committees to assist the Director. The document reflects a strong emphasis on federal control and executive power during a time of national emergency.
